content.user_title: Build ChatGPT Apps with Apps SDK
content.value_statement: This skill guides developers through creating ChatGPT Apps from concept to App Store submission. It provides templates, implementation patterns, and testing workflows for Apps using the MCP protocol.
actual_capabilities: Evaluates product fit for ChatGPT Apps using Know/Do/Show framework
Generates complete project templates with MCP server code
Creates React widget components with Apps SDK patterns
Implements authentication flows with OAuth integration
limitations: Does not execute code or deploy apps automatically
Requires users to configure their own API credentials
Does not provide hosting or infrastructure
Template code requires customization for production use

use_cases.title: Build new ChatGPT Apps
use_cases.description: Create production-ready ChatGPT Apps with widgets and MCP servers for the App Store

use_cases.title: Add MCP Integration
use_cases.description: Connect existing APIs to ChatGPT Apps using MCP protocol and OAuth authentication

use_cases.title: Test App Implementations
use_cases.description: Validate ChatGPT Apps locally using MCP Inspector and golden prompt testing

prompt_templates.title: Create new ChatGPT App
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new ChatGPT App called [AppName] that connects to [API] and displays [data type] with actions to [actions]

prompt_templates.title: Add OAuth Authentication
prompt_templates.prompt: Add OAuth authentication to my ChatGPT App with [AuthProvider] for user-specific data access

prompt_templates.title: Build Widget UI
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a widget that displays [content type] with filtering by [fields] and action buttons for [operations]

prompt_templates.title: Deploy to Production
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me prepare my ChatGPT App for App Store submission with proper health endpoints, CORS, and security headers

output_examples.input: Create a ChatGPT App for my task management API
output: Generated MCP server with task_get_tasks, task_create_item, task_complete_item tools
Created React widget with task list and action buttons
Added OAuth integration for user-specific task access
Configured ngrok tunnel for local testing

output_examples.input: Test the app with golden prompts
output: Direct prompts trigger correctly: 'Show my tasks', 'Create a task'
Indirect prompts work: 'What should I work on?'
Negative prompts do not trigger: 'Set an alarm'
All tools return expected structured content

best_practices: Follow the Know/Do/Show framework to ensure your app provides unique value beyond text responses
Use one job per tool principle and annotate tools with readOnlyHint, destructiveHint, and openWorldHint
Implement rate limiting and SSRF protection for production deployments
anti_patterns: Do not use separate paths for GET and POST MCP endpoints
Avoid hardcoding credentials in source files
Do not skip validation of image URLs in image proxy

faq.question: What is the Know/Do/Show framework?
faq.answer: A fit evaluation model where Know provides unique data, Do takes real actions, and Show displays rich UI beyond text.

faq.question: Does this skill deploy my app?
faq.answer: No, this skill generates templates and guides. You deploy using your chosen hosting provider like Fly.io or Vercel.

faq.question: What authentication does it support?
faq.answer: OAuth 2.0 with examples for Auth0, Stytch, and custom providers using the well-known endpoints pattern.

faq.question: Can I test locally before deploying?
faq.answer: Yes, use ngrok to create an HTTPS tunnel and MCP Inspector for local testing before connecting to ChatGPT.

faq.question: What UI patterns are supported?
faq.answer: List views, action buttons, loading states, dark mode, and responsive layouts using Apps SDK UI design tokens.

faq.question: How do I submit to the App Store?
faq.answer: Complete the pre-submission checklist including organization verification, tool annotations, and test credentials documentation.
